conclusion: Initial position and direction of A is on the right side moving towards the left.
Blocks are arranged in groups: blue, orange, red (vertically), green (horizontally), and a single yellow block.
Collision dynamics involve transfer of kinetic energy affecting positions and velocities.
Deflection effects occur if A hits a block at an angle, with minimal friction assumed.
A will first collide with the red blocks as they are closest to its path.
Depending on speed and angle, A may push red blocks aside or get deflected.
After red blocks, A will likely move towards the orange blocks.
A might push orange blocks over or get deflected again.
Next, A will encounter the blue blocks.
Blue blocks are taller and more stable, A might have difficulty pushing them over and could get stuck or deflected.
After colliding with blue blocks, A will likely lose most of its kinetic energy.
A may come to a stop near the blue blocks or get deflected towards the green blocks.
Green blocks are spread out, A might collide with one or two before stopping.
Final answer: A will collide with red, orange, and blue blocks in order, stopping near blue or green blocks.
